intro: Chazaliella insidens subsp. liberica, commonly known as the African violets, is a species native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. It is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. The subspecies liberica is distinguished by its slightly larger leaves and more robust growth compared to other subspecies.
